Posts.Content: On 11/4/2008 tata99 wrote: hi simona, in response to your question I did not start my Aromasin yet. The feed back was to negative. I plan to stay on Tamoxifen another 2 years and readdress the switch then. I have not seen my oncologist yet dont know what he will have to say about that. I see him in January. Maybe you could let me know how it goes for you in 3 months.  Also for your hot flashes there is a prescription  you can get for that, they work for me, they are called APO-CLONIDINE 0.025MG. Take2 tablets twice daily. Hope this will help you with hotflashes. Good luck to you, hope all goes well with your journey to a full recovery. On 11/3/2008 simona wrote: Thanks for starting this thread!  I've been looking for positive stories myself, as I prepared to switch from Tamoxifen (3 yrs) to Aromasin (for the next 2 yrs).  I remember before I started Tamoxifen reading all sorts of horror stories and never finding any good reports, but other than hot flashes I tolerated it very well.  I'm hoping it's the same story with Aromasin, which I began today. I read you planned on starting Aromasin in Sept.  How are things going for you?     Hi,  I posted the following on the same thread, but to a different member.  Wanted to make sure you got it as well. "Just an update regarding Aromasin.  It's been 3 months, and while I am experiencing some effects, it is mostly minor muscle ache and fatigue, as opposed to bone or joint pain.  It comes and goes, and none of it is debilitating. For the most part I just try to keep active so I can move through any discomfort I might be feeling.  On occasion I take Aleve and that helps a lot. I also started taking Fish Oil caps, which are more prescribed for cardio-vascular issues, but I've also read accounts that the Fish Oil helps with joint issues, skin, and general positive attitude.  Regarding fish oil, my onc says nothing to lose, everything to gain."

Posts.Content: On 11/5/2008 kcmarrio wrote: I couldn't take the Aromasin, I did have the terrible joint pain that people told me about.  The up side is that I went on Femara and at first I had the joint pain, but after a month it seemed to disappear.  I just have a little pain once in a while now.  My nurse said that I didn't give it enough time.  I don't know, but the Femara is just fine.    Good luck!!!!!! Let me know how you do. Just an update regarding Aromasin.  It's been 3 months, and while I am experiencing some effects, it is mostly minor muscle ache and fatigue, as opposed to bone or joint pain.  It comes and goes, and none of it is debilitating. For the most part I just try to keep active so I can move through any discomfort I might be feeling.  On occasion I take Aleve and that helps a lot. I also started taking Fish Oil caps, which are more prescribed for cardio-vascular issues, but I've also read accounts that the Fish Oil helps with joint issues, skin, and general positive attitude.  Regarding fish oil, my onc says nothing to lose, everything to gain. Hope you continue to do well with Femara!  I'm just so thankful there are options.
